reasoning: Vibrio parahaemolyticus is a foodborne pathogen causing gastroenteritis. Global incidence estimated at 1-5 per 100k annually, highest in coastal regions and areas with high seafood consumption. Significant geographic variation; primarily reported in developed nations with surveillance systems.
source: Letchumanan V et al. (2014). Vibrio parahaemolyticus: a review on distribution, epidemiology, virulence and interaction with the immune system. Front Microbiol. 5:article 713
